fields.description:
Once the documentation has been successfully followed for configuring federated search in sharepoint, sharepoint sometimes formats confluence search results badly.  

If this happens, the following action will fix the layout:
* Click on the small arrow to the write of "Confluence Federated Search Results WebPart"
* Choose "edit web part".  This will open a dialog to the right
* Click the plus sign next to "Display Properties" 
* Check the box for "Localization Visualization"
* Uncheck the same box for "Localization Visualization" 
* Click "ok" to close the "edit web part" dialog.
fields.summary: Need documentation to explain workaround for a very flaky sharepoint federated search problem

fields.description:
Currently personal labels (my:label) look exactly like standard labels in Confluence. This can lead to confusion when creating the label since there is no clear indicator on whether this actually is a different type of label. 

One solution could be to highlight personal labels in a different colour to clearly distinguish them from standard labels.
fields.summary: Personal labels should be easier to identify

{quote}

Steps to replicate:

1) Startup a fresh/clean 3.3 Confluence instance.
2) "Follow" a user (for testing, I had added myself as a follower - user "admin")
3) Check the "Subscribe to Network" and "Notify on my actions" checkbox under "User Preferences"
4) Watch a page in any space. For testing I had set a watch for one of the pages in the "Demonstration Space".
5) Generate a site XML backup
6) Restore the above backup either via the setup wizard or via the "Administration" console.
fields.summary: Restoring a XML site backup into 3.3 fails with "No enum const class..." exception

fields.description:
h5. Bug details
When user selects French as the language, some of the translations in Rich Text Editor breaks. For example, the drop-down menus for the heading and the {{Insert}} drop down menu. The following are the screenshots for all three language packs that are bundled with Confluence by default:

* [^RTE_english.png]
* [^RTE_german.png]
* [^RTE_french.png]

h5. Findings
Found out that in French language pack, the file /com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/tinymce_fr_FR.properties contains all the necessary translation needed:
{code}
## Confluence plugin
tinymce.confluence.conflink_desc=Ins\u00e9rer/modifier le lien (Ctrl+K)
tinymce.confluence.confimage_desc=Ins\u00e9rer l\u2019image (Ctrl+M)
tinymce.confluence.conf_macro_browser_desc=Ins\u00e9rer/modifier la macro (Ctrl+Shift+A)
tinymce.confluence_dlg.insertlink.title=Ins\u00e9rer un lien
tinymce.confluence_dlg.insertimage.title=Ins\u00e9rer une image

# Insert Menu
tinymce.confluence.conf_insert_menu=Ins\u00e9rer
tinymce.confluence.conf_image=Image
tinymce.confluence.conf_webimage=Image Web
tinymce.confluence.conf_link=Lien
tinymce.confluence.conf_attachment=Pi\u00e8ce jointe

tinymce.confluence.conf_emoticon=Emotic\u00f4ne

fields.description:
This is the error I get when I try to authenticate in Confluence :
{noformat}
 java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.security.websudo.AuthenticateAction.getUsername(AuthenticateAction.java:48)
{noformat}

We are using "external authentification" (using the Jira database in MySQL as authentification source).

We were able to reproduce the bug by pressing F5.

We cannot reproduce the bug right now.


I think if it were a problem with the SQL DB, we should get an error in the interface, the software is not supposed to crash :)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20394].
  {panel}

People who use the Office Connector with Firefox need to install a Firefox add-on called the "*WebDAV Launcher*" if they want to edit Office documents from Confluence. See our docs:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Firefox+Add-On+for+the+Office+Connector

At the moment, we do not give any information about the add-on, such as license information, versions, update history, author information, etc. This is problematic for people who need to supply such information to comply with corporate policy before they can install the add-on.

*Solution as discussed with Ryan on Friday 16 July:*
* Host the WebDAV Launcher add-on at Mozilla.
* Rename the WebDAV Launcher to include the name "Atlassian" in the title:  "*Atlassian WebDAV Launcher*".
* Change the "*Home Page*" link in the add-on metadata. At the moment, it points to "www.atlassian.com". Instead, it should point to this doc page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/A4kpCg

In addition, the tech writing team will change the above page as follows:
* Short-term: Add at least the following version and authorship information to the above doc page:
{quote}Latest version: 1.0.4
Compatible with: All versions of Firefox, up to and including 3.6.6
Author: Atlassian Pty Ltd
{quote}
* As soon as the add-on is hosted at Firefox: Replace the above short-term wording with a link to the add-on's page at Mozilla.
fields.summary: Host WebDAV launcher add-on for Firefox at Mozilla and provide information for people wanting to install it

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20393].
  {panel}

Round-tripping between RTE and Wiki Markup will break bullets formating inside some macros such as {panel}, {quote}, {note}, etc if heading is preceeding the macros

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Insert the following in Wiki Markup Editor:
{code}
* Item 1
** Sub-item 1
* Item 2 (/)
** Sub-item 2
* Item 3 (y)
** Sub-item 3
* Item 4
** Sub-item 4
{code}
!^wiki_markup.jpg!
# Save the page which will result like the following:
!^correct.jpg!
# Edit and switch to Rich Text Editor:
!^rte.jpg!
# Switch back to Wiki Markup Editor:
!^wiki_markup2.jpg!
# Save the page which will result like the following:
!^incorrect.jpg!

\\
h5. Workaround
Adding double backslashes after the emoticon seems to resolve the issue.
{code}
* Item 1
** Sub-item 1
* Item 2 (/)\\
** Sub-item 2
* Item 3 (y)\\
** Sub-item 3
* Item 4
** Sub-item 4
{code}
fields.summary: Round-tripping between RTE and Wiki Markup causes sub-item bullet to mangle if the preceding bullet has emoticon at the end of the line

h4.Problem:
When trying to install an older plugin e.g. Plugin Table, it does not appears under the search. If you try the compatibility mode, e.g. 3.2.1. it also does not return the plugins, making it impossible to download.

h4.Workaround:
Go to [Atlassian Plugins Exchange|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/home] and manually download an install under the tab "upload".

Take notice that this may cause this Known Problem, [KB Manually Uploaded Plugins From Confluence Repository Client are COrrupted|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Manually+Uploaded+Plugins+From+Confluence+Repository+Client+are+Corrupted].

fields.description:
See forum thread: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=45499&tstart=0 for a bit of background.  

There are a handful of JAR files we can't make available on a public maven repository.  This results in build errors when using the default build.sh file included with the Confluence 3.3 source distribution:


{code}
Missing:
----------
1) net.jexcell:jxcell:jar:1.2.2
 
  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.
 
  Then, install it using the command: 
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=net.jexcell -DartifactId=jxcell -Dversion=1.2.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file
 
  Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there: 
      mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=net.jexcell -DartifactId=jxcell -Dversion=1.2.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]
 
  Path to dependency: 
  	1) com.atlassian.confluence:confluence-bundled-plugins:pom:3.3
  	2) com.atlassian.confluence.officeconnector:OfficeConnector:jar:1.11
  	3) net.jexcell:jxcell:jar:1.2.2
 
2) com.aspose:aspose.words:jar:3.2.1
 
  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.
 
  Then, install it using the command: 
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=com.aspose -DartifactId=aspose.words -Dversion=3.2.1 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file
 
  Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there: 
      mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=com.aspose -DartifactId=aspose.words -Dversion=3.2.1 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]
 
  Path to dependency: 
  	1) com.atlassian.confluence:confluence-bundled-plugins:pom:3.3
  	2) com.atlassian.confluence.officeconnector:OfficeConnector:jar:1.11
  	3) com.aspose:aspose.words:jar:3.2.1
{code}

h2. Workaround

To get builds working locally:

# Download the Java mail JAR from [Sun's web site|http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/javamail-1_3_3.html].
# Download the standalone edition of Confluence from [our download site|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/ConfluenceDownloadCenter.jspa] and unpack it to a local drive.
# Deploy the JAR file to your local repo using command like: {code}
mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=javax.mail -DartifactId=mail -Dversion=1.3.3 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/opt/installs/javamail-1.3.3_01/mail.jar -Durl=file:///Users/raise-issue/.m2/repository/
{code}
# Extract the Office Connector JAR file using a command like: {code}
jar fvx /opt/confluence/3.3/confluence-3.3-std/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup/atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip OfficeConnector-1.11.jar
{code}
# Unpack the "lib" directory from the Office Connector JAR file using a command like: {code}
jar fvx /opt/confluence/3.3/confluence-3.3-std/confluence-data/bundled-plugins/OfficeConnector-1.11.jar META-INF/lib
{code}
# Install the jxcell JAR file using a command like: {code}
mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=net.jexcell -DartifactId=jxcell -Dversion=1.2.2 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=META-INF/lib/jxcell-1.2.2.jar 
{code}
# Install the aspose JAR file to your local maven repository using a command like: {code}
mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=com.aspose -DartifactId=aspose.words -Dversion=3.2.1 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=META-INF/lib/aspose.words-3.2.1.jar -Durl=file:///Users/raise-issue/.m2/repository/
{code}
# Download the Oracle OJDBC driver from [http://otn.oracle.com/].
# Install the Oracle JAR file to your local maven repository using a command like: {code}
mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=com.oracle -DartifactId=ojdbc14 -Dversion=10.2.0.4 -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/opt/installs/db/ojdbc14.jar
{code}

If you have a number of developers in your environment, you can use similar steps to install the required files on a local repository.
fields.summary: Can't build Confluence 3.3 from source distribution

fields.description:
[WHOOPS!: Duplicate of [http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5374]]

Confluence []-syntax and the linking plugin do not support all valid URI:s. For example, these are samples from the RFC:

1.3. Example URI

   The following examples illustrate URI that are in common use.

   ftp://ftp.is.co.za/rfc/rfc1808.txt
      -- ftp scheme for File Transfer Protocol services

   gopher://spinaltap.micro.umn.edu/00/Weather/California/Los%20Angeles
      -- gopher scheme for Gopher and Gopher+ Protocol services

   http://www.math.uio.no/faq/compression-faq/part1.html
      -- http scheme for Hypertext Transfer Protocol services

   mailto:mduerst@ifi.unizh.ch
      -- mailto scheme for electronic mail addresses

   news:comp.infosystems.www.servers.unix
      -- news scheme for USENET news groups and articles

   telnet://melvyl.ucop.edu/
      -- telnet scheme for interactive services via the TELNET Protocol

Of these all except the news-variant is supported. In my current situation I would have needed that syntax to work. (We got a client software for CRM-tasks and we need to link to it with links like limecrm:project.Lime IT.reslim01?9401 which currently won't work.) We had to active the html-macro as a workaround.
fields.summary: Support all types of URI:s specified by RFC2396

fields.description:
It was initially believed that a Confluence user account had to have some kind of Global Admin privilege to allow the editing of any space's PDF stylesheet/layout:
* *The PDF Layout* --- for example, http://confluence.atlassian.com/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdflayoutconfig.action?key=ALLDOC and
* *The PDF Stylesheet* --- for example, http://confluence.atlassian.com/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdfstyleconfig.action?key=ALLDOC

If I log in to Confluence using an account with Space Administrator permissions for the ALLDOC space (but which has no Global Admin privileges), the two options above do not appear in the space's Space Administration area.

However, if I log in with this same account, copy the URLs above and paste them into my browser window, I can access these stylesheets, edit their content and save it.

We originally believed this lack of links on the space admin UI to be expected behaviour, due to a perceived risk of running malicious code in these text boxes (CONF-5808).  Therefore, the fact that you could access these URLs (without Global Admin privileges) was believed to be a security risk - hence, the creation of this JAC issue. However...

----

After discussing this with Ryan Ackley, there doesn't appear to be a security risk for the PDF stylesheet/layout templates. So, instead of restricting access to these functions to confluence administrators, these functions can be made available to space administrators as well. 

The fix is to re-enable the "PDF Layout" and "PDF Stylesheet" menu items if the user is a space administrator. The "Layout" and "Stylesheet" will continue to be restricted to confluence administrators (i.e. current behaviour).

----

See [Craig's comment|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5808?focusedCommentId=204999&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-204999] on CONF-5808, which backs up this claim.
fields.summary: A user can access a space's PDF Layout/Stylesheets without global Confluence admin permissions.

fields.description:
Customers with some of the [unsupported single sign-on solutions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Single+Sign-on+Integration+with+JIRA+and+Confluence] can't easily upgrade to Confluence 3.3 because WebSudo doesn't handle external SSO solutions.

See this example: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions?focusedCommentId=221446417#comment-221446417

Users can't get into the admin console to disable web sudo

The workaround for this is to start [Confluence in Development Mode|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Enabling+Developer+Mode], disable web sudo, then restart confluence in a normal mode.
fields.summary: Enable Web Sudo to work with other single-sign-on solutions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20363].
  {panel}

Like a desktop OS's trashcan, would be great to be able to drag one or more pages from Tree view into a UI trashcan. Can have options to prompt "are you sure" or option to suppress. 

If removing files are not allowed at the Admin permissions level for a user, the icon would not be displayed in the UI. 

Certainly other ways to implement it too. just idea.

== 

Use case:

Overtime, orgs evolve their wiki "structures" and whereas they start all in one or a few spaces, eventually a space gets crowded - and they want to split it. So they use the Copy Space plugin, and then delete the extra files from the split.

In such case, they'd be deleting alot of pages from the copied space. 

I think this is a core platform type feature more than a plugin feature.
fields.summary: Allow multi-file "remove" via dragging files to a UI trash can

<item>
            <title>[ADM-8558] Kent St: wall mounted build monitors for JIRA team</title>
                <link>https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/ADM-8558</link>
                <project id="10080" key="ADM">SysAdmin</project>
                        <description><p>As you can see around the office we have several monitors showing info that is important for the team.  This includes burndown charts, build status, bug counts, etc</p>

<p>Currently the monitors are too small and too low.  I would like to see bigger wall mounted monitors.  In terms of what I think we need.</p>

<p>For the wall behind me:</p>

<ul class="alternate" type="square">

	<li>1 x 50 inch full HD LCD (with HDMI input)</li>
	<li>1 x VESA bracket for the wall mounting</li>
	<li>1 x DVI to HDMI cable (similar to what we have in the Neo boardroom)</li>
	<li>1 x cabinet/credenza to sit the machines that drive the build monitors on. **</li>

</ul>


<p>For the wall behind JC (ie the Greenhopper team)</p>

<ul class="alternate" type="square">
	<li>1 x 50 inch full HD LCD (with HDMI input)</li>

	<li>1 x VESA bracket for the wall mounting</li>
	<li>1 x DVI to HDMI cable (similar to what we have in the Neo boardroom)</li>
	<li>1 x cabinet/credenza to sit the machines that drive the build monitors on.</li>
</ul>


<p>For the "column" next to Brad and behind Penny we need:</p>

<ul class="alternate" type="square">
	<li>1 x 45-47 inch full HD LCD (with HDMI input)*</li>

	<li>1 x VESA bracket for the wall mounting</li>
	<li>1 x DVI to HDMI cable (similar to what we have in the Neo boardroom)</li>
	<li>1 x cabinet/credenza to sit the machines that drive the build monitors on. **</li>
</ul>


<ul>
	<li>50 inch is too big for the column we would mount the monitor on.</li>
</ul>


<ul>
	<li>

	<ul>
		<li>currently we are using the big filing cabinets from JTB but that are too big and bulky if end up wall mounting the monitors.</li>
	</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

<p>I think there may be some challenges mounting the monitor on the column behind Penny so you should get Jet Master in to quote on the job.</p></description>

fields.description:
When using the viewfile macro to view a password protected PDF file, the following exception is thrown 3 times, and then the user sees a message telling him that the PDF is still being rendered and to refresh the page later. Upon refreshing the same exception is thrown another 3 times.

{noformat}
com.sun.pdfview.decrypt.PDFAuthenticationFailureException: Password failed authentication for both owner and user password
	at com.sun.pdfview.decrypt.StandardDecrypter.<init>(StandardDecrypter.java:188)
	at com.sun.pdfview.decrypt.PDFDecrypterFactory.createStandardDecrypter(PDFDecrypterFactory.java:316)
	at com.sun.pdfview.decrypt.PDFDecrypterFactory.createDecryptor(PDFDecrypterFactory.java:99)
	at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.readTrailer(PDFFile.java:1085)
	at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.parseFile(PDFFile.java:1397)
	at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.<init>(PDFFile.java:129)
	at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.<init>(PDFFile.java:101)
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlideConversionThread.convertFile(SlideConversionThread.java:74)
	at com.benryan.conversion.SlideConversionThread.run(SlideConversionThread.java:127)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
{noformat}

The fix could either be to support password protected PDFs by allowing the user to enter a password in a password field in the PDF viewer macro, or to display an appropriate error message such as "The file foo.pdf cannot be displayed because it is password protected."

See attachment for example PDF.

fields.description:
The rich text editor strips characters from the code block of a document in edit mode.  To illustrate the issue, perform the following:

1. Open a new blank document for editing.
2. Click on the Wiki Markup tab in the editor (if it's not the default).
3. Enter the following in the content window of the editor:
This is: {code} a problem {+}, this is not {1} {code}
4. Click on the preview tab, you should see the the + symbol and 1 wrapped in braces within a code block, as intended.
5. Click on the Rich Text tab (no need to make any edits).
6. Click on the Preview tab again (the braces will now be removed from around the + symbol).

From what we can determine, the issue is associated with the functionality involving the Rich Text editor tab.  As long as you avoid the Rich Text tab, you can bounce back a forth between the Wiki Markup and preview without this issue occurring.

The workaround is to set the Wiki Markup tab as the default and avoid the Rich Text tab altogether.  If this cannot be fixed, then there should be a per user configurable option to remove the Rich Text tab from appearing in the editor so that one doesn't accidentally wipe out their edits as described.  The Rich Text editor functionality essentially appears to be useless for all but the most basic text editing anyway.
fields.summary: Rich text editor strips characters from code blocks.

fields.description:
The reasoning behind preventing theme developers from theming the admin areas was because if you don't know what you are doing then you can mess things up to such an extent that you are unable to use confluence.

By decorating the sudo login pages using the global decorator it exposes the user to the possibility that they can lock themselves out of confluence - for this reason I believe the sudo should be decorated either using it's own decorator, or through the admin decorator.
fields.summary: sudo is decorated with global decorator

* [^psm_error.jpg]

This problem only takes place in Confluence 3.3. 

*Temporary Workaround*
Install [Atlassian Universal Plugin Manager|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/23915] and use the Enable Safe mode feature in the plugin, it works the same with Plugin Support Mode.
fields.summary: System Error when entering plugin support mode in Confluence 3.3
Implement gdocument and gdocumentlist macros

fields.description:
When edit in word feature is used.
Content does not get saved from WebDav.

Steps to reproduce:

*Create a test page
*Click on tools -> Edit in word
*Makes some changes to the test page document
*Click save.
*Reload test page.

Notice the changes are not applied.

{code}

h3.WORKAROUND

* Browse through your bundled plugins folder should be <confluence_data>\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\setup\atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip

* Unzip the files under a known location, locate OfficeConnector-1.11.jar save a copy, and delete it from the original location.

* Download [OfficeConnector-1.8.jar|https://plugins.atlassian.com/server/1.0/download/pluginVersion/23715] and place inside this location.

* Zip the folder contents ( DO NOT ZIP THE FOLDER, ONLY THE FILES INSIDE IT, THE ZIP file MUST NOT CONTAIN FOLDERS)

* Rename to atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip and place in original location: {{<confluence install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/setup}}

* DONE!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20337].
  {panel}

A few more ideas for keyboard shortcuts, stolen from [my markup plugin|https://labs.atlassian.com/source/browse/MARKUP/trunk/src/main/resources/com/atlassian/confluence/plugin/markup/markup-buttons.js?r=3223].

Some of these were pinched from the RTE, but others didn't make it into Confluence 3.2 or 3.3:

{code}
    var hotkeys = {
        "Ctrl+B": "bold",
        "Ctrl+I": "italic",
        "Ctrl+U": "underline",
        "Ctrl+-": "strikethrough",
        "Ctrl+=": "subscript",
        "Ctrl+Shift+=": "superscript",
        "Ctrl+Shift+8": "bulleted-list",
        "Ctrl+Shift+3": "numbered-list",
        "Tab": "indent",
        "Shift+Tab": "outdent",
        "Ctrl+'": "quote"
    };
{code}

Two more that are specified elsewhere:

- Ctrl+' for blockquote
- Ctrl+1, 2, 3 for headings

In general, the shortcuts line up with either Microsoft Word or wiki markup (e.g. Ctrl+* for bullet points)

I think different keyboard layouts (e.g. European) might mean different ways of the same character has a different keycode. Something I didn't get far in testing yet.
fields.summary: More ideas for editor keyboard shortcuts

fields.description:
If a user saves a page with only a space in the title, the page sometimes saves, resulting in a page with a bad database entry that cannot be changed.  The title will print as $helper.page.title, and if you edit the page, the title is blank.  If you try to add a title and change the page, you get a system error.

This is related to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-48567 .

(I initially thought this happened every time -- a user reported they had done this, and when I tested it it worked, but I've since found that a lot of the time it doesn't work -- a page with only spaces in the title usually will not save.  Blog pages with just a space do, however, seem to save reliably each time, giving a reproducable case.)
fields.summary: Giving a page a title containing only spaces results in an uneditable page with no title

fields.description:
Switching from Wiki-Markup to Rich Text editing mode, Confluence generates a new version with "0" changes, for the following scenario.

Steps for replication (Wiki Markup is default):
1) Create a new page "Test 0 Version" and save
2) Modify the body to "text" and save
3) There are two versions now, which is good
4) Switch to Rich Text and save, no new version, as expected
5) Enter a second line "text" and save
6) There are three versions now, as expected
7) Switch again to Rich Text and save
8) A new page version is created
9) "Changes (0)" reported when viewing the version changes  

Checking for the actual content stored in the database under the BODYCONTENT table, the two page versions have:
{noformat}
text\n\ntext\n
{noformat}
and
{noformat}
text\r\n\r\ntext\r\n
{noformat}
fields.summary: "\r\n" added when switching from wiki-markup to rich-text mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20330].
  {panel}

Sometimes images are quite large, such as screenshots and artwork. When exporting this to PDF or even PRINT this will consume a lot of pages. 

In my situation I create diagrams using Gliffy on different pages. I have to make use of web image macro to add reference images from my other pages so that I do not have to copy the PNG images to every page. This prevents diagrams from getting out of date on different pages.

example macro : !http://server:8282/download/attachments/4292627/BbM-General-Usage-Workflow.png|border=1, width=640, height=400!

It will be really nice to allow web image macro to:
1) be resized via the macro "height, width"
2) have an "Expand/Collapse" button for each image allowing the user to view the actual size of the image on the same page.
3) support thumbnail view of web images on the current page.
fields.summary: Allow web images to be shown as thumbnail, or specified size.

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to detach/remove images in the RTE's image browser.

If you find that you uploaded a wrong image, it is tedious to go to the page
attachments and then remove images there. Therefore it would be good if images
could easily be removed (e.g. via a context menu) in the image browser.

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce
*Scenario 1*
# Ensure your IE window is maximized
# Edit a page and go to Wiki Markup editor
# [^normal_maximized_IE.png]. The vertical scroll bar should be there.
# Restore down the IE window.
# [^broken_restored_down_IE.png]. The vertical scroll bar disappeared.

\\
*Scenario 2*
# Ensure your IE window is restored down (_not_ maximized)
# Edit a page and go to Wiki Markup editor
# [^normal_restored_down_IE.png]. The vertical scroll bar should be there.
# Maximize the IE window.
# [^broken_maximized_IE.png]. The vertical scroll bar is misplaced.

\\
h5. Findings
This problem seems to be only reproducible in Wiki Markup Editor and in IE 8.
|| Confluence Version || Remark ||
| 3.2, 3.2.1_0.1, 3.3 | Reproducible |
| 3.0.0_0.1, 3.1 | Not reproducible |

\\
h5. Workaround
# Turn on {{Compatibility View}} on IE (via {{Tools}} > {{Compatibility View}}). You can add your Confluence to be always displayed in {{Compatibility View}} at {{Tools}} > {{Compatibility View Settings}}.
# Switch to Rich Text editor or Preview, then switch back to Wiki Markup editor.
fields.summary: Vertical scroll bar of Wiki Markup Editor disappear or misplaced when IE 8 window is restored down or maximized

fields.description:
When the Easy Reader theme is enabled, a piece of hint text displayed in the Confluence editor that is particularly long can cause the right-hand side of the editor to be pushed behind the easy reader's border.

This problem is more commonly encountered when Confluence is set to use languages with longenwordenmakentextuberlong, such as German :).

In 3.2.2, we solved this problem with a German hint text translation simply by shortening the German text, but this problem could continue to re-appear until a more elegant (read: automatic) solution is implemented.
fields.summary: Fix problem where long hint text in Confluence editor makes the right-hand side of the editor inaccessible in Easy Reader theme

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to use the functionality in the recently-updated macro but to reverse the order of the function to indicate which child pages have not been updated in a long time.

We have a number of procedural pages listed in Confluence and I'd like to be able to highlight the pages which were modifed the longest ago in order to ensure the data in the pages is revisted regularly and updated as necessary.  The returned data set would show the name of the page, the author and the last modifed date/time, just like the current macro, just in reverse order.

Ideally the macro could also include a parameter so that it would limit the return data set to a set number of entries.

{recently-updated:spaces=[Space to Search]|sort=reverse|show=[Number of entries returned]}

fields.description:
*Steps* 
_this requires a Jira that has a heaps of filters_
# Register a Jira Gadget with Confluence that uses filters, like Pie Chart
# Edit a confluence page
# click the add macro button
# choose the Pie Chart external content gadget
# in the filter box, I want my private filter called *all*. So I type {{all}}. 

*Expected Result*
My filter *all* is in the auto complete list. I select it. Click Insert and all is good

*Actual Result*
# My auto complete result does not have my *all* filter and is instead full of a dozen other filters shared by others with the word *all* in it.
# if I leave the filter input box with the word *all* in it and click Insert, I get an error stating that I must select a valid filter

*Work Around*
# Select an unwanted filter from the list in Confluence
# click Insert
# Discover the filter id in Jira
# delete the unwanted filter id from the text of the macro in wiki markup and insert the correct filter id. _However, our average user already got lost about 10 steps ago..._

*Suggested Remedies*
# In Jira, improve the auto complete results so that exact matches are returned first (JRA-19918)
# include the *Advanced Search* link that appears in Jira when adding the same gadget in Confluence.
fields.summary: The Jira Advanced Search filter picker is not available when adding a gadget to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20295].
  {panel}

This applies to all Atlassian products. Confluence is the one that I need it in the most.
Right now, with Jira 4.1 and Confluence 3.2.1_01, here are the steps I have to take to add ONE Jira gadget to Confluence 
1. In Jira Dashboard, click Add Gadget 
2. In Jira, find the gadget in the Gadget Directory
3. In Jira, copy the Gadget URL 
4. In Confluence, paste the Gadget URL into the Add a new Gadget box
5. Click Add

And then repeat 46 more times for every Jira Gadget we have.

Ugh.

It seems like all that an admin should have to do is tell Confluence where Jira (or FishEye, Bamboo, etc.) is and Confluence should be able to figure out what Gadgets are available and prompt the admin with the list with check boxes and an OK button.
fields.summary: Automate Gadget Registration between Atlassian Products

fields.description:

*The only way to access the fields is to _know_ this problem, and hit TAB until all fields, including 'Save' become visibile*

See attached pics.  In 3.3 the 'picker' stuff is missing entirely, in 3.2 some fields are present, though I can't tell if the picker is there or not due to placement.

I'll also attach a copy of the Jira Time Tracking Gadget if you want to reproduce (not looking for code changes - its a confluence config render problem) - at least it'll give you the gadget spec etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20282].
  {panel}

Confluence should respond instantly to every button that's pressed on the UI. This includes:
 * disable all other buttons on the screen
 * highlight and/or otherwise indicate which option was selected
 * re-enable all the buttons if something goes wrong (e.g. there's a timeout or a server error) or the user browses back to the page

This will eliminate double-click submit errors, and will also help users tell more easily if they've drag clicked (which does nothing) rather than clicking on a button.

Even if we do nothing else on the back-end to speed up the application, implementing this will make Confluence feel snappier and more responsive.
fields.summary: Respond instantly to button presses

fields.description:
Currently in the Word export, the request object is a stub that doesn't include the parameters which are passed to the Word servlet.

We can improve this by setting the ServletActionContext request and response objects appropriately. These will be picked up by macros and other code using VelocityUtils in the page rendering.

A patch for Confluence 3.0 and later is attached. To install it, put [^ExportWordPageServer.class] and [^ExportWordPageServer$1.class] into {{confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/servlet/}}, creating that directory if it doesn't already exist.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20270].
  {panel}

During initial startup of a freshly installed Confluence, there are multiple warnings printed about attempting to serialize SpoolingBlobInputStreamType, which isn't serializable. We should either make sure this class is never serialized, or update the class to make it Serializable/Externalizable.

[15:42:00]    WARN custom type does not implement Serializable: class org.springframework.orm.hibernate.support.SpoolingBlobInputStreamType
[15:42:00]    INFO Building new Hibernate SessionFactory
[15:42:02]    WARN Could not find configuration [com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.ImageDetailsDto]; using defaults.
[15:42:12]    WARN custom type does not implement Serializable: class org.springframework.orm.hibernate.support.SpoolingBlobInputStreamType
[15:42:12]    WARN custom type does not implement Serializable: class org.springframework.orm.hibernate.support.SpoolingBlobInputStreamType
[15:42:14]    INFO Initialising the plugin system

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20268].
  {panel}

 * Offer to add a shortcut to a confluence start/stop app to the quick launch bar and desktop
 * Put the confluence app start menu item under "All Programs\Atlassian\Confluence x.x" rather than "All Programs\Confluence Evaluation x.x". Add a shortcut in this same menu to some (or any) docs installed with the app.
 * Provide a version of the installer that bundles (a tested & supported version of) the JVM, so that the user will definitly be able to start confluence after the installer completes. This could replace the prompt to go download java if its not already installed.
 * On first startup, warn the user that they might see a firewall prompt for Java, and that they need to Allow it network access.
 * Use native look&feel for the launcher desktop app, and allow copy and paste from the logs.
 * Show the user where the log is, so they can get to it easily (to send it to Atlassian if/when things break, etc).
fields.summary: Windows Installer improvements

fields.description:
One of the most significant items in the profiled performance builds is in the {{ConfluenceVelocityManager.addContainerContexts(...)}} method - specifically in the calls into Spring.

In some of the profiles it takes 6% of runnable time and 13% of blocked time.

As a lot of these container contexts are not required, lazily requesting them when actually required should significantly reduce pressure on Spring.
fields.summary: Performance improvement: Lazy evaluation of Velocity context
